Next time they announce that they're going to announce something inÃ‚Â·credÃ‚Â·iÃ‚Â·ble, I'll be a bit more inÃ‚Â·credÃ‚Â·uÃ‚Â·lous.
Real proud of you Squad. It's heartwarming to see how few people even care about your next big cash grab, and nice job calling this a "dev note".

\*headdesk\*

Words cannot express my disappointment. Nothing on dealing with RAM issues? Heating overlay crashes? Heating issues? Klaw bugs? Multicore support? Unity 5? 64 bit?

Of all things, they pull THIS out of their hat. This isn't even worthy of an April Fools joke.
Congrats! The Playstation gets a lot of cool Indies you wouldn't expect on a console, recently Assetto Corsa also was announced for PS4.

Yeah, good for you, income means more development, yadda yadda

Where's my damn notes?
The complain is not on the news, it's actually nice to have ksp in other platforms, but this is not a dev notes.
This isn't a dev note. More of a bank note.

Guys chill out. Yes, the lack of a dev note is disappointing. But why get mad at SQUAD for releasing their game on a new platform? Yes, it is an opportunity for them to make money, but so what? It doesn't mean that they are gonna leave all us PC gamers in the dust.

Yeah this is a bit disappointing to hear. KSP is literally the last game I would see working on a console; its too technical, its too complex. I fly with a Xbox controller, but I would never ever ever want to do the rest of the game with it.

KSP isn't done yet, there's plenty left to do. We all know your team is very small, and frankly any time spent on a PS4 port feels like its being taken from your actual fanbase, your actual customers; to what? Join the multitudes chasing the console gamers?

It's sort of ironic that you announced this during the PC E3 showcase tonight. You guys should have been there announcing something new and awesome for your fanbase, to let us know you have plans going froward... not that you're looking elsewhere.

Don't know what else to say.

And there we have it ladies and gentlemen. Squad has officially reached the fanbase dissonance event horizon, where no hope for a proper handling of the post-release strategy for this game can ever possibly escape. Here we have a once promising game bursting with potential now hobbling along as a disparate hodge-podge of incomplete features, imbalanced gameplay, and inconsistent styling that is (mercifully) completely fixable by third party modification, and yet due to the limited vision of what can only reasonably be described as an exhausted and impatient corporate structure none of these highly sought after improvements and rebalances have or will ever likely be remarked upon with any commitment or ambition. I am now fully convinced that the future of KSP lays solely in your hands, modding community. As somebody who does not nor plans to ever own a Playstation 4, X-Bone, WiiWiggle or whatever they're calling it now, I honestly (and forgive me for my bluntness) could not give two flying \*\*\*\*s about KSP being on PS4. Why anybody thought this would be a good idea is likely to elude me for many months, before I inevitably give up the good crusade of hoping Squad will ever again release a bit of news that is even remotely in line with the general concensus of the community it was made for and just download 42 gigabytes of realism mods.

I give up, guys. I'm so tired, and broken... Goodnight.
